text:
Oh gosh, I can imagine. My nephew has actually been better during the lockdown - the whole environment of school is too stressful for him so he's much happier now. I hope that things get easier with time.

Yeah, I'm looking forward to it. She may be getting called back into work, though, making it a but more difficult. She's asked to be furloughed since her store don't need all of their employees but almost everyone has so we just have to wait and see. She's been incredibly anxious about going back so I hope they let her stay off.

That's a really good point. Perspective can be half the battle sometimes so I appreciate it. That's a much more reasonable way of looking at it. Absolutely. I'm not big into reading but I've found it a lot more enjoyable recently with audiobooks. The last one I really got into was The Song of Achilles by Madeline Miller. I absolutely adored it and couldn't stop thinking about it for a month afterwards. It even sparked a new interest in Greek mythology. I'd recommend it. How about you?
